 class CTBlumPartyOne
          This class plays as party one of coin tossing Blum protocol, which tosses a single bit.
 class CTBlumPartyTwo
          This class plays as party two of coin tossing Blum protocol, which tosses a single bit.
 class CTSemiSimulatablePartyOne
          This class plays as party one of coin tossing protocol which tosses a string.
 class CTSemiSimulatablePartyTwo
          This class plays as party two of coin tossing protocol which tosses a string.
 class CTStringPartyOne
          Concrete implementation of a protocol for tossing a string from party one's point of view.
 class CTStringPartyTwo
          Concrete implementation of a protocol for tossing a string from party two's point of view.

Uses of SecurityLevel in edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.commitmentScheme.equivocal

 class CmtEquivocalCommitter
          Concrete implementation of Equivocal commitment scheme in the committer's point of view.
 class CmtEquivocalReceiver
          Concrete implementation of Equivocal commitment scheme in the receiver's point of view.Pseudo code: This is a protocol to obtain an equivocal commitment from any commitment with a ZK-protocol of the commitment value.Pseudo code: The equivocality property means that a simulator can decommit to any value it needs (needed for proofs of security).

Uses of SecurityLevel in edu.biu.scapi.securityLevel
 

Subinterfaces of SecurityLevel in edu.biu.scapi.securityLevel
 interface Cca1
          An encryption scheme that is secure in the presence of preprocessing chosen-ciphertext attacks (meaning that the decryption oracle is available only before the challenge ciphertext is provided) should implement this interface.
 interface Cca2
          An encryption scheme that is secure in the presence of (full) chosen-ciphertext attacks should implement this interface.
 interface CDH
          A group in which the computational Diffie-Hellman problem is assumed to hold should implement this interface.
 interface ChannelSecLevel
          This interface is the root interface of the channel security level family.
 interface CollisionResistant
          A hash function H is collision resistant if it is infeasible to find two distinct values x and y such that H(x)=H(y).
 interface CommitSecLevel
           
 interface Covert
          Any protocol that is secure in the presence of covert adversaries should implement this interface.
 interface Cpa
          An encryption scheme that is secure in the presence of chosen-plaintext attacks should implement this interface.
 interface DDH
          A group in which the decisional Diffie-Hellman problem is assumed to hold should implement this interface.
 interface Dlog
          A group in which the discrete log problem is assumed to hold should implement this interface.
 interface DlogSecLevel
          This hierarchy specifies the security level of a cyclic group in which discrete log hardness is assumed to hold.
 interface Eav
          An encryption scheme that is only secure for eavesdropping adversaries (like a stream cipher) should implement this interface.
 interface EncSecLevel
          This hierarchy specifies the security level of encryption schemes; it does not differentiate between symmetric and asymmetric encryption.
 interface EquivocalCmt
           
 interface ExtractableCmt
           
 interface FullyTrapdoorCmt
           
 interface HashSecLevel
          This hierarchy specifies the security level of a cryptographic hash function.
 interface Indistinguishable
          This interface should be used when the security level of the encryption scheme is according to the regular indistinguishability game that defines privacy.
 interface MacSignSecLevel
          This hierarchy specifies the security level of a message authentication code (MAC) or digital signature scheme.
 interface Malicious
          Any protocol that is secure in the presence of malicious adversaries should implement this interface.
 interface NonMalleable
          This interface should be used for encryption schemes that achieve non-malleability, meaning that it is infeasible for an adversary to generate a related ciphertext.
 interface NonMalleableCmt
           
 interface OneSidedSimulation
           
 interface OneTime
          Any MAC or signature scheme that is secure for one-time use only should implement this interface.
 interface Perfect
          This interface should be used for any primitive, scheme or protocol that achieves perfect security (e.g., a perfect MAC, one-time pad, perfectly-secure multiparty protocol, and so on).
 interface PerfectlyBindingCmt
          Any commitment scheme that is perfectly binding should implement this interface.
 interface PerfectlyHidingCmt
          Any commitment scheme that is perfectly hiding should implement this interface.
 interface PrivacyOnly
           
 interface ProtocolSecLevel
          This interface is the root interface of the security level hierarchy for (secure computation) protocols.
 interface SecureCommit
           
 interface SemiHonest
          Any protocol that is secure in the presence of semi-honest adversaries should implement this interface.
 interface StandAlone
          Any protocol that is proven secure in the stand-alone model (where secure protocols are run sequentially and not concurrently) should implement this interface.
 interface Statistical
          This interface should be used for any primitive, scheme or protocol that achieves statistical security (e.g., a perfect MAC, one-time pad, perfectly-secure multiparty protocol, and so on).
 interface StatisticallyHidingCmt
           
 interface TargetCollisionResistant
          A hash function is target collision resistant if it is infeasible for an adversary to succeed in the following game: the adversary chooses a message x; next a random key K is chosen for the hash function and given to the adversary; finally the adversary outputs some y (not equal to x) such that H_K(x)=H_K(y).
 interface UC
          Any protocol that is universally composable (aka.
 interface UnlimitedTimes
          Any MAC or signature scheme that is secure for an unlimited number of uses should implement this interface.
 

Overview  Package  Class   Use  Tree  Deprecated  Index  Help 
 PREV   NEXT FRAMES    NO FRAMES
